Wisdom: يُسْتَدَلُّ عَلَى إِدْبَارِ الدُّوَلِ بِأَرْبَعٍ تَضْيِيعُ الْأُصُولِ وَالتَّمَسُّكُ بِالْغُرُورِ وَتَقْدِيمُ الْأَرَاذِلِ وَتَأْخِيرُ الْأَفَاضِلِ
enWisdom: The decline [and imminent fall] of empires is evinced by four things: neglecting the principles [and core values of justice and equity], clinging to vanities, promotion of the wicked and demotion of the virtuous

Wisdom: وَلَئِنْ أَمْهَلَ اللَّهُ تَعَالَى الظَّالِمَ فَلَنْ يَفُوتَهُ أَخْذَهُ وَهُوَ لَهُ بِالْمِرْصَادِ عَلَى مَجَازِ طَرِيقِهِ وَمَوْضِعِ الشَّجَا مِنْ مَجَازِ رِيقِهِ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: الْقُدْرَةُ تُنْسِي الْحَفِيظَةَ
enWisdom: Power makes one forget [about] self-preservation

Wisdom: الْوِلَايَاتُ مَضَامِيرُ الرِّجَالِ
enWisdom: Sovereignties are the arenas of men

Wisdom: الْمُلْكُ الْمُنْتَقِلُ الزَّائِلُ حَقِيرٌ يَسِيرٌ
enWisdom: Transient and fleeting kingship is wretched and insignificant

Wisdom: الْقُدْرَةُ تُظْهِرُ مَحْمُودَ الْخِصَالِ وَمَذْمُومَهَا
enWisdom: Power manifests the praiseworthy and blameworthy qualities [of an individual]

Wisdom: الدَّوْلَةُ كَمَا تُقْبِلُ تُدْبِرُ
enWisdom: Just as [wealth and] authority comes towards you, it turns away from you

Wisdom: الْمَحَاسِنُ فِي الْإِقْبَالِ هِيَ الْمَسَاوِي فِي الْإِدْبَارِ
enWisdom: The merits in advancing forward are the demerits in turning backward

Wisdom: الشِّرْكَةُ فِي الْمُلْكِ تُؤَدِّي إِلَى الِاضْطِرَابِ
enWisdom: Partnership in sovereignty leads to turmoil

Wisdom: الذُّلُّ بَعْدَ الْعَزْلِ [الْعِزِّ] يُوَازِي عِزَّ الْوِلَايَةِ
enWisdom: The disgrace after being deposed is equal to the glory of sovereignty

Wisdom: الْمَرْءُ يَتَغَيَّرُ فِي ثَلَاثٍ الْقُرْبِ مِنَ الْمُلُوكِ وَالْوِلَايَاتِ وَالْغَنَاءُ مِنْ [بَعْدِ] الْفَقْرِ فَمَنْ‏ لَمْ يَتَغَيَّرْ فِي هَذِهِ فَهُوَ ذُو عَقْلٍ قَوِيمٍ وَخُلُقٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ
enWisdom: The human being changes in three instances: when he is close to kings, when he gains positions of authority and when he becomes wealthySo whoever does not change in these conditions, then he is one who possesses a strong intellect and an upright character

Wisdom: التَّسَلُّطُ عَلَى الضَّعِيفِ وَالْمَمْلُوكِ مِنْ لُزُومِ [لُؤْمِ‏] الْقُدْرَةِ
enWisdom: Dominating the weak and the slave are from the exigencies (or wickedness) of power

Wisdom: اجْعَلْ لِكُلِّ إِنْسَانٍ مِنْ خَدَمِكَ عَمَلًا تَأْخُذُهُ بِهِ فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ أَحْرَى أَنْ لَا يَتَوَاكَلُوا فِي خِدْمَتِكَ
enWisdom: Assign for each one of your servants work that you hold him responsible for, as indeed this is more appropriate to ensure that they do not depend upon one another in your service

Wisdom: إِذَا تَغَيَّرَتْ نِيَّةُ السُّلْطَانِ تَغَيَّرَ [فَسَدَ] الزَّمَانُ
enWisdom: When the intention of the king changes, the times change [or get corrupted]

Wisdom: إِذَا رَأَيْتَ اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ يُتَابِعُ عَلَيْكَ النِّعَمَ مَعَ الْمَعَاصِي فَهُوَ اسْتِدْرَاجٌ لَكَ
enWisdom: When you see Allah continuously sending blessings upon you despite your sins, then [know that] it is a means of driving you [towards greater punishment]

Wisdom: إِذَا نَفَذَ حُكْمُكَ فِي نَفْسِكَ تَدَاعَتْ أَنْفُسُ النَّاسِ إِلَى عَدْلِكَ
enWisdom: When your judgment is applied upon yourself [thereby showing your justice], the souls of [other] people summon each other towards your justice

Wisdom: تَكَبُّرُكَ فِي الْوِلَايَةِ ذُلٌّ فِي الْعَزْلِ
enWisdom: Your haughtiness in sovereignty will be [the cause of your] disgrace in deposition

Wisdom: جُودُ الْوُلَاةِ بِفَيْ‏ءِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ جَوْرٌ وَخَتَرٌ
enWisdom: The generosity of rulers with booty belonging to the Muslims is [an act of] injustice and betrayal

Wisdom: حُسْنُ الشُّهْرَةِ حِصْنُ الْقُدْرَةِ
enWisdom: Good renown is a fortification of power

Wisdom: دَاوُوا الْجَوْرَ بِالْعَدْلِ وَدَاوُوا الْفَقْرَ بِالصَّدَقَةِ وَالْبَذْلِ
enWisdom: Remedy injustice with justice and cure poverty with alms and charity

Wisdom: رُبَّ عَادِلٍ جَائِرٌ
enWisdom: Many a just person is an oppressor

Wisdom: رَحْمَةُ مَنْ لَا يَرْحَمُ تَمْنَعُ الرَّحْمَةَ وَاسْتِبْقَاءُ مَنْ لَا يَبْقَى يُهْلِكُ [تُهْلِكُ‏] الْأُمَّةَ
enWisdom: Showing compassion to one who does not show compassion [to others] prevents [divine] mercy, and sparing one who does not spare others destroys the nation

Wisdom: زَلَّةُ الرَّأْيِ تَأْتِي عَلَى الْمُلْكِ وَتُؤْذِنُ بِالْهُلْكِ
enWisdom: Erroneous opinion annihilates the kingdom and heralds destruction

Wisdom: زَوَالُ الدُّوَلِ بِاصْطِنَاعِ السِّفَلِ
enWisdom: The fall of nations results from the appointment of depraved leaders

Wisdom: سُلْطَانُ الدُّنْيَا ذُلٌّ وَعُلْوُهَا سُفْلٌ
enWisdom: The sovereignty of this world is disgrace and its loftiness is lowness

Wisdom: سِتَّةٌ تُخْتَبَرُ بِهَا عُقُولُ الرِّجَالِ [النَّاسِ‏] الْمُصَاحَبَةُ وَالْمُعَامَلَةُ وَالْوِلَايَةُ وَالْعَزْلُ وَالْغِنَى وَالْفَقْرُ
enWisdom: There are six situations in which the intellects of people are tested: association, transaction, authority, isolation, affluence and poverty

Wisdom: سَاهِلِ الدَّهْرَ مَا ذَلَّ لَكَ قُعُودُهُ وَلَا تُخَاطِرْ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ رَجَاءَ أَكْثَرَ [كثر] مِنْهُ
enWisdom: Be flexible with time when it submits itself to you and do not put anything in danger out of hope for gaining more [than it]

Wisdom: صَوَابُ الرَّأْيِ بِالدُّوَلِ وَيَذْهَبُ بِذَهَابِهَا
enWisdom: Correct opinion [and decision] comes with [the coming of] power and it vanishes with its disappearance

Wisdom: صَيِّرِ الدِّينَ حِصْنَ دَوْلَتِكَ وَالشُّكْرَ حِرْزَ نِعْمَتِكَ فَكُلُّ دَوْلَةٍ يَحُوطُهَا الدِّينُ لَا تُغْلَبُ وَكُلُّ نِعْمَةٍ يَحْرُزُهَا الشُّكْرُ لَا تُسْلَبُ
enWisdom: Make religion the fortress of your state and [make] gratitude the protection of your blessings, for every state that is surrounded by religion will not be defeated and every blessing that is protected by gratitude will not be taken away

Wisdom: ظُلْمُ الْمُسْتَسْلِمِ أَعْظَمُ الْجُرْمِ
enWisdom: Injustice to the one who has surrendered is the greatest crime

Wisdom: ظُلْمُ الضَّعِيفِ أَفْحَشُ الظُّلْمِ
enWisdom: Being unjust to the weak is the most grievous injustice

Wisdom: قَدْ يُعَذَّرُ الْمُتَحَيِّرُ الْمَبْهُوتُ
enWisdom: It is possible for the one who is perplexed and bewildered to be excused

Wisdom: ظُلَامَةُ الْمَظْلُومِينَ يُمْهِلُهَا اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ وَلَا يُهْمِلُهَا
enWisdom: The oppressors of the oppressed are given respite by Allah, the Glorified, but are not overlooked

Wisdom: قَلَّمَا يَعُودُ الْإِدْبَارُ إِقْبَالًا
enWisdom: It is seldom that one who turns back [and retreats] returns to the front

Wisdom: قُوَّةُ سُلْطَانِ الْحُجَّةِ أَعْظَمُ مِنْ قُوَّةِ سُلْطَانِ الْقُدْرَةِ
enWisdom: The strength of the authority of evidence is stronger than the strength of the authority of force

Wisdom: كَيْفَ يَهْتَدِي الضَّلِيلُ مَعَ غَفْلَةِ الدَّلِيلِ
enWisdom: How can the one who is astray be guided aright when the guide [he follows] is heedless?!

Wisdom: لِكُلِّ دَوْلَةٍ بُرْهَةٌ
enWisdom: For every empire there is a period [after which it falls]

Wisdom: لِكُلِّ كَبِدٍ حُرْقَةٌ [حُرْمَةٌ]
enWisdom: For every heart there is anguish

Wisdom: لَئِنْ أَمِرَ الْبَاطِلُ لَقَدِيماً فَعَلَ لَئِنْ قَلَّ الْحَقُّ لَرُبَّمَا وَلَعَلَّ لَقَلَّمَا أَدْبَرَ شَيْ‏ءٌ فَأَقْبَلَ
enWisdom: If falsehood dominates, it has [always] been so in the past, and if truth diminishes, that too has often occurred and may [again] happenIt is seldom that a thing lags behind and remains behind

Wisdom: لَنْ يَتَمَكَّنَ الْعَدْلُ حَتَّى يَزِلَّ الْبَخْسُ
enWisdom: Justice can never be achieved until injustice falters [and comes to an end]

Wisdom: لَنْ يَهْلِكَ مَنِ اقْتَصَدَ
enWisdom: One who is moderate will never be ruined

Wisdom: مَنْ بَذَلَ جَاهَهُ اسْتُحْمِدَ
enWisdom: One who benefits others with his high rank makes himself praiseworthy

Wisdom: مَنْ أَحْسَنَ الْمَلَكَةَ أَمِنَ الْهَلَكَةَ
enWisdom: One whose disposition is good [with those who are under him] remains safe from annihilation

Wisdom: مَنْ ضَعُفَتْ آرَاؤُهُ قَوِيَتْ أَعْدَاؤُهُ
enWisdom: One whose opinions are weak, his enemies become stronger

Wisdom: مَنْ وَثِقَ بِإِحْسَانِكَ أَشْفَقَ عَلَى سُلْطَانِكَ
enWisdom: One who relies upon your goodness is concerned about [the end of] your rule

Wisdom: مَنْ خَافَ سَوْطَكَ تَمَنَّى مَوْتَكَ
enWisdom: One who fears your whip wishes for your death

Wisdom: مَنْ حُمِدَ عَلَى الظُّلْمِ مُكِرَ بِهِ
enWisdom: One who is praised for injustice is being plotted against [and deceived]

Wisdom: مَنْ شُكِرَ عَلَى الْإِسَاءَةِ سُخِرَ بِهِ
enWisdom: One who is praised for that which is not in him is ridiculed by it

Wisdom: مَنْ أَطَاعَ أَمْرَكَ أَجَلَّ قَدْرَكَ
enWisdom: One who obeys your command has exalted your status

Wisdom: مَنْ أَسَاءَ إِلَى رَعِيَّتِهِ سَرَّ حُسَّادَهُ
enWisdom: One who wrongs his subjects pleases his enviers

Wisdom: مَنْ رُفِعَ بِلَا كِفَايَةٍ وُضِعَ بِلَا جِنَايَةٍ
enWisdom: One who is raised [to a high rank] without competence is dropped without wrongdoing

Wisdom: مَنْ أَشْفَقَ عَلَى سُلْطَانِهِ قَصَّرَ عَنْ عُدْوَانِهِ
enWisdom: One who is concerned about his kingship curtails his aggression

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَسْتَظْهِرْ بِالْيَقَظَةِ لَمْ يَنْتَفِعْ بِالْحَفَظَةِ
enWisdom: One who does not take support through vigilance will not benefit from [the presence of] guards

Wisdom: مَنْ جَعَلَ مُلْكَهُ خَادِماً لِدِينِهِ انْقَادَ لَهُ كُلُّ سُلْطَانٍ
enWisdom: One who makes his kingship subservient to his religion, every king will submit to him

Wisdom: مَنْ جَعَلَ دِينَهُ خَادِماً لِمُلْكِهِ طَمِعَ فِيهِ كُلُّ إِنْسَانٍ
enWisdom: When one makes his religion subservient to his kingship, every person will covet it

Wisdom: مَنْ رَبَّاهُ الْهَوَانُ أَبْطَرَتْهُ الْكَرَامَةُ
enWisdom: One who is raised by disgrace is made vain by high esteem

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُحْسِنْ فِي دَوْلَتِهِ خُذِلَ فِي نَكْبَتِهِ
enWisdom: One who does not show kindness [to others] in times of fortune will be abandoned in times of misfortune

Wisdom: مِنْ حَقِّ الرَّاعِي أَنْ يَخْتَارَ لِرَعِيَّتِهِ مَا يَخْتَارُهُ لِنَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: It is from the right of the shepherd to choose for his flock that which he chooses for himself

Wisdom: لَا تَظْلِمَنَّ مَنْ لَا يَجِدُ نَاصِراً إِلَّا اللَّهَ
enWisdom: Never oppress one who has no helper except Allah

Wisdom: لَا تَبْسُطَنَّ يَدَكَ عَلَى مَنْ لَا يَقْدِرُ عَلَى دَفْعِهَا عَنْهُ
enWisdom: Do not stretch out your hand against one who is unable to stave it off from himself

Wisdom: لَا تُحَارِبْ مَنْ يَعْتَصِمُ بِالدِّينِ فَإِنَّ مُغَالِبَ الدِّينِ مَحْرُوبٌ
enWisdom: Do not fight against the one who seeks refuge in religion, for one who combats religion is ruined

Wisdom: لَا تَنْقُضَنَّ سُنَّةً صَالِحَةً عُمِلَ بِهَا وَاجْتَمَعَتِ الْأُلْفَةُ لَهَا وَصَلَحَتِ الرَّعِيَّةُ عَلَيْهَا
enWisdom: Do not discontinue the good practices that have been [previously] acted upon, and which the people have become familiar with, and which the masses have found suitable

Wisdom: لَا يَنْجَعُ تَدْبِيرُ مَنْ لَا يُطَاعُ
enWisdom: There is no benefit in the planning of one who is not obeyed

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الْعَمَالِقَةُ وَأَبْنَاءُ الْعَمَالِقَةِ
enWisdom: Where are the ‘Am?liqa and the children of the ‘Am?liqa?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الْجَبَابِرَةُ وَأَبْنَاءُ الْجَبَابِرَةِ
enWisdom: Where are the tyrants and the children of the tyrants?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ أَهْلُ مَدَائِنِ الرَّسِّ الَّذِينَ قَتَلُوا النَّبِيِّينَ وَأَطْفَئُوا نُورَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
enWisdom: Where are the people of the cities of Rass who killed the Prophets and extinguished the light of the Messengers?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الَّذِينَ كَانُوا أَحْسَنَ آثَاراً وَأَعْدَلَ أَفْعَالًا وَأَكْبَرَ [أَكْثَرَ] مُلْكاً
enWisdom: Where are those who left the best heritage, were most just in their actions and had the biggest kingdoms?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الَّذِينَ قَالُوا مَنْ أَشَدُّ مِنَّا قُوَّةً وَأَعْظَمُ جَمْعاً
enWisdom: Where are those who said, “Who is more powerful than us and is greater in assemblage?”

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الَّذِينَ عَسْكَرُوا الْعَسَاكِرَ وَمَدَّنُوا الْمَدَائِنَ
enWisdom: Where are those who rallied the troops and inhabited the cities?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الَّذِينَ هَزَمُوا الْجُيُوشَ وَسَارُوا بِالْأُلُوفِ
enWisdom: Where are those who vanquished the armies and travelled in the thousands?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الَّذِينَ شَيَّدُوا الْمَمَالِكَ وَمَهَّدُوا الْمَسَالِكَ وَأَغَاثُوا الْمَلْهُوفَ وَقَرَوُا الضُّيُوفَ
enWisdom: Where are those who built kingdoms, paved passages, and aided the aggrieved and hosted guests?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ مَنْ سَعَى وَاجْتَهَدَ وَأَعَدَّ وَاحْتَشَدَ
enWisdom: Where is the one who strived and struggled, and prepared and mobilized [all possible resources]?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ مَنْ حَصَّنَ وَأَكَّدَ وَزَخْرَفَ وَنَجَّدَ
enWisdom: Where is the one who fortified and strengthened, and adorned and decorated?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ مَنْ جَمَعَ فَأَكْثَرَ وَاحْتَقَبَ وَاعْتَقَدَ وَنَظَرَ بِزَعْمِهِ لِلْوَلَدِ
enWisdom: Where is the one who accumulated and increased, and stored and amassed, and considered the future of his son?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ مَنِ ادَّخَرَ وَاعْتَقَدَ وَجَمَعَ الْمَالَ عَلَى الْمَالِ فَأَكْثَرَ
enWisdom: Where is the one who stored and amassed, and accumulated wealth upon wealth thereby multiplying it?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ كِسْرَى وَقَيْصَرُ وَتُبَّعٌ وَحِمْيَرٌ
enWisdom: Where is Khosrau and Caesar and Tubba’ and Himyar?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ مَنْ بَنَى وَشَيَّدَ وَفَرَشَ وَمَهَّدَ وَجَمَعَ وَعَدَّدَ
enWisdom: Where is the one who built and erected, paved and prepared, accumulated and counted?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ مَنْ كَانَ مِنْكُمْ أَطْوَلَ أَعْمَاراً أَوْ أَعْظَمَ آثَاراً
enWisdom: Where are those who lived longer than you and left a greater heritage?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ مَنْ كَانَ أَعَدَّ عَدِيداً وَأَكْنَفَ جُنُوداً وَأَعْظَمَ آثَاراً
enWisdom: Where are the ones who were larger in numbers, had stronger armies and had greater effect?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الْمُلُوكُ وَالْأَكَاسِرَةُ
enWisdom: Where are the kings and Khosraus?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ بَنُو الْأَصْفَرِ [الْأَصْغَرِ] وَالْفَرَاعِنَةُ
enWisdom: Where are the children of the Yellow and the pharaohs?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الَّذِينَ اسْتَذَلُّوا الْأَعْدَاءَ وَمَلَكُوا نَوَاصِيَهَا
enWisdom: Where are those who used to humiliate their enemies and take possession of their forelocks [by enslaving them]?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الَّذِينَ بَلَغُوا مِنَ الدُّنْيَا أَقَاصِيَ الْهِمَمِ
enWisdom: Where are those who attained their highest ambitions in this world?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الَّذِينَ دَانَتْ لَهُمُ الْأُمَمُ
enWisdom: Where are those to whom the nations were subservient?

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الَّذِينَ مَلَكُوا مِنَ الدُّنْيَا أَقَاصِيَهَا
enWisdom: Where are those who ruled the extremities of this world?
